title: Bug 124610: Add a filter on a boolean computed column will cause error.
OB: When adding a filter on a boolean computed column, an error occurs. The error message is: 'data.engine.ConvertToDataTypeError: org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: can not be converted to class java.lang.Boolean.'
EB: The filter on the boolean computed column should work without any error.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:

1. Create a new BIRT sample data source and a dataset from the 'orders' table.
2. Create a computed column named 'yes/no' with the type 'any' (not a boolean value) and the value 'if(row[1]%2==0){true;}else{false;}'.
3. Drag the dataset from the Data Explorer to the Layout.
4. Select the table and click on the 'Filters' tab in the Property Editor.
5. Click the 'Add' button.
6. Select 'yes/no' as the Expression and 'Is True' as the Operator.
